a.g: By those [angels] lined up in rows
And those who drive [the clouds]
And those who recite the message,
Indeed, your God is One,
Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.
Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما الحكمة في سائر الكواكب السيارة منها والثوابت فخفية لا يطلع عليها كافة الخلق والقدر الذي يحتمله فهم الخلق انها زينة للسماء لتستلذ العين بالنظر اليها وأشار اليه قوله تعالى: ﴿ إنا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب ﴾ {} فجميع اجزاء العالم سماؤه وكواكبه ورياحه وبحاره وجباله ومعادنه ونباته وحيواناته وأعظاء حيواناته لا تخلو ذرة من ذراته عن حكم كثيرة من حكمة واحدة الى عشرة الى الف الى عشرة آلاف وكذا أعضاء الحيوان تنقسم الا ما يعرف حكمتها كالعلم بأن العين للإبصار لا للبطش واليد للبطش لا للمشي والرجل للمشي لا للشم فاما الاعضاء الباطنة من الامعاء والمرارة والكبد والكلية وآحاد العروق والاعصاب والعضلات وما فيها من التجاويف والالتفاف والاشتباك والانحراف والدقة والغلظ وسائر الصفات فلا يعرف الحكمة فيها سائر الناس والذين يعرفونها لا يعرفون منها إلا قدرا يسيرا بالاضافة الى ما في علم الله تعالى ﴿ وما أوتيتم من العلم الا قليلا ﴾ {}
Indeed, as for the wisdom [ḥikma] in all the stars, the wandering and the fixed, it is hidden; not all of creation is made aware of it. The measure that the understanding of creation can bear is that they are an adornment for the heaven, so that the eye may take delight in looking upon them. And He alluded to this by His saying, the Most High: "Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven [al-samā' al-dunyā] with an adornment of stars." (37:6) Thus, all parts of the world [al-ʿālam]—its heaven, its stars, its winds, its seas, its mountains, its minerals, its plants, its animals, and the limbs of its animals—not a single atom [dharrā] of its atoms is devoid of many wisdoms, from one, to ten, to a thousand, to ten thousand. And likewise, the limbs of the animal are divided, except for what is known of their wisdom, such as the knowledge [ʿilm] that the eye is for sight, not for striking, and the hand is for striking, not for walking, and the foot is for walking, not for smelling. But as for the internal limbs—the intestines, the gallbladder, the liver, the kidney, the individual veins, nerves, and muscles, and what is in them of cavities, convolutions, intertwinings, deviations, fineness, thickness, and all other attributes—their wisdom is not known by most people. And those who know them know of them only a very little amount in comparison to what is in the knowledge [ʿilm] of God, the Most High: "And you have not been given of knowledge except a little." (17:85)

a.g: And as protection against every rebellious devil
[So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,
Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,
Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
Then inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created men from sticky clay.
But you wonder, while they mock,
And when they are reminded, they remember not.
And when they see a sign, they ridicule
And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
And our forefathers [as well]?"
Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."
It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
[They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
[The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds, and what they used to worship
Other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فى قوله تعالى: ﴿ فاهدوهم إلى صراط الجحيم. وقفوهم إنهم مسئولون ﴾ فالناس من بعد هذه الأهوال يساقون إلى الصراط وهو جسر ممدود على متن النار أحد من السيف وأدق من الشعر فمن استقام فى هذا العالم على الصراط المستقيم خف على صراط الآخرة ونجا ومن عدل عن الاستقامة فى الدنيا وأثقل ظهره بالأوزار وعصى تعثر فى أول قدم من الصراط وتردى فتفكر الآن فيما يحل من الفزع بفؤادك إذا رأيت الصراط ودقته ثم وقع بصرك على سواد جهنم من تحته ثم قرع سمعك شهيق النار وتغيظها وقد كلفت أن تمشى على الصراط مع ضعف حالك واضطراب قلبك وتزلزل قدمك وثقل ظهرك بالأوزار المانعة لك عن المشى على بساط الأرض فضلا عن حدة الصراط فكيف بك إذا وضعت عليه إحدى رجليك فأحسست بحدته واضطررت إلى أن ترفع القدم الثانية والخلائق بين يديك يزلون ويتعثرون وتتنازلهم زبانية النار بالخطاطيف والكلاليب وانت تنظر إليهم كيف يتنكسون فتتسفل إلى جهة النار رءوسهم وتعلوا أرجلهم فياله من منظر ما أفظعه ومرتقى ما أصعبه ومجاز ما أضيقه فانظر إلى حالك وأنت تزحف عليه وتصعد إليه وأنت مثقل الظهر بأوزارك تلتفت يمينا وشمالا إلى الخلق وهم يتهافتون فى النار والرسول عليه السلام يقول: (يا رب سلم سلم) والزعقات بالويل والثبور قد ارتفعت إليك من قعر جهنم للكثرة من زل عن الصراط من الخلائق فكيف بك لو زلت قدمك ولم ينفعك ندمك فناديت بالويل والثبور وقلت هذا ما كنت أخافه فياليتنى قدمت لحياتي يا ليتنى اتخذت مع الرسول سبيلا يا ويلتا ليتنى لم اتخذ فلانا خليلا يا ليتنى كنت ترابا يا ليتنى كنت نسيا منسيا يا ليت أمى لم تلدنى، وعند ذلك تختطفك النيران والعياذ بالله وينادى المنادى اخسئوا فيها ولا تكلمون فلا يبقى سبيل إلا الصياح والأنين والتنفس والاستغاثة فكيف ترى الآن عقلك وهذه الأخطار بين يديك فإن كنت غير مؤمن بذلك فما أطول مقامك مع الكفار فى دركات جهنم وإن كنت به مؤمنا وعنه غافلا وبالاستعداد له متهاونا فما أعظم خسرانك وطغيانك وماذا ينفعك
Indeed, in His saying, the Most High: "Then lead them to the path of Hell. And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned." The people, after these terrors, are driven to the Path [al-Sirat], which is a bridge stretched over the back of the Fire, sharper than the sword and finer than a hair. Whoever was upright [istaqama] in this world on the Straight Path [al-Sirat al-Mustaqim] will find the Path of the Hereafter light and will be saved. And whoever deviated from uprightness [istiqama] in the world [dunya] and burdened his back with sins [awzar] and disobeyed will stumble at the first step on the Path and will fall. So reflect now on what terror would settle in your heart [fu'ad] if you saw the Path and its fineness, then your sight fell upon the blackness of Hell beneath it, then your hearing was struck by the roaring of the Fire and its rage, and you were charged to walk on the Path despite the weakness of your state, the agitation of your heart [qalb], the trembling of your foot, and the heaviness of your back with sins [awzar] that prevent you from walking on the carpet of the earth, let alone the sharpness of the Path. How then will you be when you place one of your feet upon it and feel its sharpness, and you are compelled to lift the second foot, while the creatures before you are slipping and stumbling, and the guardians of Hell pull them down with hooks and grappling irons, and you look at them as they are turned upside down, their heads descending towards the Fire and their feet raised? Oh, what a sight, how dreadful it is! And what a difficult ascent! And what a narrow passage! So look at your state as you crawl upon it and climb it, while you are burdened with your sins [awzar], turning right and left to the creatures as they plummet into the Fire, and the Messenger, peace be upon him, is saying: "O Lord, grant safety, grant safety!" And the cries of "Woe!" and "Ruin!" have risen to you from the depths of Hell due to the multitude of creatures who slipped from the Path. How then will you be if your foot slips and your regret does not benefit you, and you cry out "Woe!" and "Ruin!" and say, "This is what I used to fear! Oh, would that I had sent ahead for my life! Oh, would that I had taken with the Messenger a way! Oh, woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so as a friend! Oh, would that I were dust! Oh, would that I were forgotten, utterly forgotten! Oh, would that my mother had not borne me!" And at that, the fires snatch you—we seek refuge in God—and the caller calls out: "Be driven into it, and do not speak to Me!" Then no way remains except screaming, groaning, panting, and calling for help. So how do you see your intellect now, with these dangers before you? If you are not a believer in that, how long your stay will be with the disbelievers in the depths of Hell! And if you are a believer in it, yet heedless of it and negligent in preparing for it, how great is your loss and your transgression! And what will benefit you?

a.g: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
[They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
But they, that Day, are in surrender.
And they will approach one another blaming each other.
They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."
The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,
And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allah," were arrogant
And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,
And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
Those will have a provision determined -
Fruits; and they will be honored
In gardens of pleasure
On thrones facing one another.
There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
White and delicious to the drinkers;
No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد قيل إذا كانت المرأة حسناء خيرة الأخلاق سوداء الحدقة والشعر كبيرة العين شديدة بياض اللون محبة لزوجها قاصرة الطرف عليه فهي على صورة الحور العين فإن الله تعالى وصف نساء أهل الجنة بهذه الصفة في قوله (خيرات حسان) أراد بالخيرات حسنات الأخلاق وفي قوله (قاصرات الطرف) وفي قوله (عربا أترابا) العروب هي العاشقة لزوجها المشتهية للوقاع وبه تتم اللذة والحور البياض والحوراء شديدة بياض العين شديدة سوادها في سواد الشعر والعيناء الواسعة العين.
And it has been said: When a woman is beautiful [hasanā'], of excellent character [khayra al-akhlāq], with dark pupils and hair, large eyes, intensely white in complexion, loving towards her husband, and restraining her gaze [qāṣirāt al-ṭarf] upon him, then she is in the likeness of the wide-eyed maidens [ḥūr al-ʿīn]. For God, exalted is He, described the women of the people of Paradise with this attribute in His saying, "good [khayrāt], beautiful [ḥisān]" — intending by "good" [khayrāt] goodness of character [ḥasanāt al-akhlāq] — and in His saying, "restraining their gaze [qāṣirāt al-ṭarf]," and in His saying, "loving [ʿuruban], of equal age [atrāban]." The loving one [al-ʿarūb] is she who is passionately in love with her husband, desirous of intimacy, and through this pleasure is perfected. And "ḥūr" is whiteness, and "ḥawrā'" is she of intensely white eyes and intensely dark pupils, with dark hair and eyes. And "ʿīn" is the wide-eyed one.

a.g: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth]
Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe
That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
He will say, "Would you [care to] look?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ويقال: ﴿ أفسخر هذا أم أنتم لا تبصرون اصلوها فاصبروا أو لا تبصروا سواء عليكم إنما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون ﴾ {} أعلم أن في رسول الله ﭬ أسْوة حَسَنة حَيًّا وميتا وفعلا وقولا وجميع أحواله عبرة للناظرين وتبصرة للمستبصرين إذ لم يكن أحد أكرَمُ على الله منه إذ كان خليل الله وحبيبه ونجيه وكان صفيه ورسوله ونبيه. فأنظر هل أمهله ساعة عند انقضاء مدته وهل أخره لحظة بعد حضور منيته لا بل أرسل إليه الملائكة الكرام الموكلين بقبض أرواح الأنام فجدوا بروحه الزكية الكريمة لينقلوها وعالجوها ليرحلوها عن جسده الطاهر إلى رحمة ورضوان وخيرات حسان بل إلى مقعد صدق في جوار الرحمن فاشتد مع ذلك في النزع كربه وظهر أنينه وترادف قلقه وارتفع حنينه وتغير لونه وعرق جبينه واضطربت في الإنقباض والإنبساط شماله ويمينه حتى بكى لمصرعه من حضره وانتحب لشدة حاله من شهد منظره. فهل رأيت منصب النبوة دافعا عنه مقدورا وهل راقب
Indeed, it is said: "Is this then a mockery, or do you not see? Enter it, then be patient or do not be patient—it is all the same to you. You are only being recompensed for what you used to do." (37:54-55) Know that in the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, there is a beautiful example [uswa hasana], alive and deceased, in action and speech, and all his states are an admonition [ibra] for those who look and an insight [tabsira] for those who seek insight, for there was no one more honored by God than him, since he was the intimate friend [khalil] of God and His beloved [habib] and His confidant, and He was His chosen one [safi] and His Messenger and His Prophet. So look: Did He grant him respite for a single hour when his appointed term [mudda] ended? Did He delay him for a moment after his death [maniyya] arrived? No! Rather, He sent to him the noble angels [mala'ika], entrusted with seizing the souls [arwah] of mankind, and they hastened with his pure [zakiyya], noble spirit [ruh] to transfer it, and they struggled with it to remove it from his pure [tahir] body towards mercy [rahma] and pleasure [ridwan] and beautiful blessings—nay, towards a seat of truth [maq'ad sidq] in the proximity [jiwar] of the All-Merciful [al-Rahman]. Yet, despite that, the distress [karb] of the death throes [naza'] intensified upon him, his groaning [anin] became apparent, his anxiety [qalaq] followed in succession, his lamentation [hanin] rose, his color changed, his forehead [jabin] sweated, and his left and right sides trembled in contraction and expansion, until those present wept for his demise [masra'], and those who witnessed his state [hala] sobbed at its severity. So have you seen the station [mansab] of prophethood [nubuwwa] ward off from him what was decreed [maqdur]? Have you observed...

a.g: And he will look and see him in the midst of the Hellfire.
He will say, "By Allah, you almost ruined me.
If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
Then, are we not to die
Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
Indeed, this is the great attainment.
For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقيل فتح عبد الله بن المبارك عينه عند الوفاة وضحك وقال: ﴿ لمثل هذا فليعمل العاملون ﴾ {}
Indeed, it is said that 'Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak opened his eye at the moment of death and laughed, saying: "For the like of this let the workers work."

a.g: Is Paradise a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?
Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم انظر إلى طعامهم وهو الزقوم كما قال الله تعالى: ﴿ إنها شجرة تخرج فى أصل الجحيم طلعها كأنه رءوس الشياطين فإنهم لآكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون ثم إن لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم ثم إن مرجعهم لإلى الجحيم ﴾ {} وقال ابن عباس قال رسول الله ﭬ: (لو أن قطرة من الزقوم قطرت فى بحار الدنيا أفسدت على أهل الدنيا معايشهم فكيف من يكون طعامه ذلك؟[203]) وقال أبو الدرداء قال رسول الله ﭬ: (يلقى على أهل النار الجوع حتى يعدل ما هم فيه من العذاب فيستغيثون بالطعام فيغاثون بطعام من ضريع لا يسمن ولا يغنى من جوع ويستغيثون بالطعام فيغاثون بطعام ذى غصة فيذكرون كما كانوا يجيزون الغصص فى الدنيا بشراب فيستغيثون بشراب فيرفع إليهم الحميم بكلاليب الحديد فإذا دنت من وجوههم شوت وجوههم فإذا دخل الشراب بطونهم قطع ما فى بطونهم فيقولون ادعوا خزنة جهنم قال فيدعون خزنة جهنم أن ادعوا ربكم يخفف عنا يوما من العذاب فيقولون أو لم تك تأتيكم رسلكم بالبينات قالوا بلى قالوا فادعوا وما دعاء الكافرين إلا فى ضلال قال فيقولون ادعوا مالكا فيدعون فيقولون يا مالك ليقض علينا ربك قال فيجيبهم إنكم ماكثون[205])
Indeed, then look at their food, and it is the Zaqqum [az-zaqqūm], as Allah the Exalted has said: "Indeed, it is a tree that emerges from the base of Hellfire. Its fruit is as if it were the heads of devils. Then indeed, they will eat from it and fill their bellies with it. Then indeed, for them upon that is a mixture of scalding water. Then indeed, their return will be to Hellfire." And Ibn 'Abbas said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "If a single drop of the Zaqqum were to drip into the seas of the world [ad-dunyā], it would corrupt the livelihoods of the people of the world. So how about one whose food is that?" And Abu ad-Darda' said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Hunger is cast upon the people of the Fire until it equals the punishment they are in. So they cry out for food, and they are given food from *Dhari'* which neither fattens nor satisfies hunger. And they cry out for food, and they are given food that causes choking. And they remember how they used to clear a choking [ghuṣaṣ] in the world [ad-dunyā] with a drink, so they cry out for a drink. And the scalding water [al-ḥamīm] is raised to them with hooks of iron. When it draws near to their faces, it scorches their faces. And when the drink enters their bellies, it cuts what is in their bellies. So they say, 'Call the keepers of Hell [Jahannam].' So they call the keepers of Hell [Jahannam], 'Call upon your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment.' They say, 'Did not your messengers come to you with clear proofs?' They say, 'Yes.' They say, 'Then call. But the call of the disbelievers is only in error.' So they say, 'Call Malik.' So they call. And they say, 'O Malik, let your Lord decree for us.' He answers them, 'Indeed, you will remain.'"

a.g: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.
And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
Indeed they found their fathers astray.
So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
And We had already sent among them warners.
Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
Then We drowned the disbelievers.
And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
[And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?
Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
And he cast a look at the stars
And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
So they turned away from him, departing.
Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?
What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"
And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
Then the people came toward him, hastening.
He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
While Allah created you and that which you do?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفي قوله تعالى والله خلقكم وما تعملون الأصل الأول: العلم بأن كل حادث في العالم فهو فعله وخلقه واختراعه لا خالق له سواه ولا محدث له إلا إياه خلق الخلق وصنعهم وأوجد قدرتهم وحركتهم فجميع أفعال عباده مخلوقة له ومتعلقة بقدرته تصديقا له في قوله تعالى الله خالق كل شيء وفي قوله تعالى والله خلقكم وما تعملون وفي قوله تعالى وأسروا قولكم أو اجهروا به إنه عليم بذات الصدور ألا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير أمر العباد بالتحرز في أقوالهم وأفعالهم وإسرارهم وإضمارهم لعلمه بموارد أفعالهم واستدل على العلم بالخلق وكيف لا يكون خالقا لفعل العبد وقدرته تامة لا قصور فيها وهي متعلقة بحركة أبدان العباد والحركات متماثلة وتعلق القدرة بها لذاتها فما الذي يقصر تعلقها عن بعض الحركات دون البعض مع تماثلها أو كيف يكون الحيوان مستبدا بالاختراع ويصدر من العنكبوت والنحل وسائر الحيوانات من لطائف الصناعات ما يتحير فيه عقول ذوي الألباب فكيف انفردت هي باختراعها دون رب الأرباب وهي غير عالمة بتفصيل ما يصدر منها من الاكتساب هيهات هيهات ذلت المخلوقات وتفرد بالملك والملكوتجبار الأرض والسموات.
Indeed, in His saying, the Most High: "And Allah created you and what you do" [37:96]. **The First Foundation:** The knowledge [ma'rifa] that every originated thing in the world [al-'alam] is His act [fi'l], His creation [khalq], and His invention [ikhtira'], with no creator [khalq] for it other than Him and no originator [muhdith] for it except Him. He created the creation [al-khalq] and fashioned them, and He brought into existence their power [qudra] and their movement [haraka]. Thus, all the actions [af'al] of His servants are created [makhluqa] by Him and connected to His power [qudra], in confirmation of Him in His saying, the Most High: "Allah is the Creator [Khaliq] of all things" [39:62], and in His saying, the Most High: "And Allah created you and what you do" [37:96], and in His saying, the Most High: "Whether you conceal your speech or proclaim it, indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts [sudur]" [67:13]. "Does He who created not know?" [67:14] And He is the Subtle, the Acquainted. He commanded the servants to be cautious in their statements, their actions [af'al], their secrets [asrar], and their hidden thoughts, due to His knowledge ['ilm] of the sources of their actions [af'al]. And He argued for the knowledge ['ilm] through the creation [khalq]. And how could He not be the Creator [Khaliq] of the servant's action [fi'l], when His power [qudra] is perfect, with no deficiency in it, and it is connected to the movement [haraka] of the servants' bodies? And the movements [harakat] are alike, and the connection of the power [qudra] to them is for their own essence. So what is it that restricts its connection from some movements [harakat] and not others, given their similarity? Or how could the animal be independent in invention [ikhtira'], when from the spider, the bee, and all other animals issue subtle crafts [sana'at] that confound the intellects [uqul] of those of understanding [al-albab]? So how could they be singled out in inventing [ikhtira'] them, apart from the Lord of lords, when they are not knowing ['alima] of the details of what issues from them of acquisition [iktisab]? Far, far is it! The created beings [al-makhluqat] are humbled, and He is alone in dominion [al-mulk] and sovereignty [al-malakut], the Compeller of the earths and the heavens.

a.g: They said, "Construct for him a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."
And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.
And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن الفرار إلى الله عز وجل هو غاية السالكين، حيث يتحقق فيهم قوله تعالى: ﴿لعلكم تذكرون﴾، فيفروا إلى الله ويتجلى فيهم معنى الاعتزال عن كل ما سواه، كما في قوله تعالى: ﴿وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا الله فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته﴾، وإليه الإشارة بقوله: ﴿إني ذاهب إلى ربي سيهدين﴾، فهذه منتهى درجات الصديقين، ولا وصول إليها إلا بعد ترتيب الأوراد والمواظبة عليها دهراً طويلاً، فلا ينبغي أن يغتر المريد بما سمعه فيدعيه لنفسه ويفتر عن وظائف عبادته، فعلامة ذلك أن لا يهجس في قلبه وسواس ولا يخطر فيه معصية ولا ترعجه هواجم الأهوال ولا تستفزه عظائم الأشغال، وأنى ترزق هذه الرتبة لكل أحد، فيتعين على الكافة ترتيب الأوراد، وجميع ما ذكر طرق إلى الله تعالى.
Indeed, the flight [al-firar] to God, Mighty and Majestic, is the ultimate goal of the wayfarers [al-salikin], wherein is realized in them His saying, Exalted is He: "That you may remember [la'allakum tadhakkarun]," so they flee to God and is manifested in them the meaning of isolation [al-i'tizal] from all besides Him, as in His saying, Exalted is He: "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship except God, then take refuge in the cave; your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy." And to this is the allusion by His saying: "Indeed, I am going to my Lord; He will guide me [inni dhaahibun ila rabbi sayahdini]." This is the utmost of the degrees of the truthful [al-siddiqin], and there is no arrival at it except after arranging the litanies [al-awrad] and persisting in them for a long age. So let not the seeker [al-murid] be deceived by what he has heard and claim it for himself and become remiss in the duties of his worship. The sign of that is that no whisper [waswas] stirs in his heart [qalb], nor does any disobedience [ma'siyah] occur within it, nor do the assaults of terrors unsettle him, nor do the enormities of preoccupations agitate him. And how can this rank [al-rutbah] be granted to everyone? Therefore, it is incumbent upon all to arrange the litanies [al-awrad], and all that has been mentioned are paths to God, Exalted is He.

a.g: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the steadfast."
And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,
We called to him, "O Abraham,
You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, this was the clear trial.
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Abraham."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.
And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.
And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
And We gave them the explicit Scripture,
And We guided them on the straight path.
And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allah?
Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators -
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
Except the chosen servants of Allah.
And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
"Peace upon Elias."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومنها المنقول المنقلب كقوله تعالى ﴿ وطور سينين ﴾ {} أي طورسيناء ﴿ سلام على إل ياسين ﴾ {} أي على الياس وقيل إدريس لأن في حرف ابن مسعود سلام على إدراسين
Indeed, among them is the transferred and reversed [al-manqūl al-munqalib], as in His Exalted saying: "And Mount Sinai [Ṭūr Sinīn]" – meaning Mount Sinai [Ṭūr Saynā’] – "Peace be upon the family of Yasin [Āl Yāsīn]" – meaning upon Elias [Ilyās]. And it is said: Idris [Idrīs], because in the manuscript of Ibn Mas'ud it reads: "Peace be upon the family of Idrasin [Āl Idrāsīn]."

a.g: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
[So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
Except his wife among those who remained [with the evildoers].
Then We destroyed the others.
And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وعلى القعود عن هذا السفر وقع الإنكار بقوله تعالى وإنكم لتمرون عليهم مصبحين وبالليل أفلا تعقلون
Indeed, you pass by them in the morning [musbihīn] and by night [wa bil-layl]—will you not then reflect [ta`qilūn]?

a.g: And at night. Then will you not use reason?
And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
[Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
And he drew lots and was among the losers.
Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.
And had he not been of those who exalt Allah,
He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.
But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.
And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
So inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?
Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
" Allah has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
Has He chosen daughters over sons?
What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
Then will you not be reminded?
Or do you have a clear authority?
Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.
And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [punishment].
Exalted is Allah above what they describe,
Except the chosen servants of Allah [who do not share in that sin].
So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.
[The angels say], "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فاعلم أن خلقه الملائكة تخالف خلقة الإنس وما من واحد منهم إلا وهو وحدانى الصفة ليس فيه خلط وتركيب ألبتة فلا يكون لكل واحد منهم إلا فعل واحد، وإليه الإشارة بقوله تعالى: ﴿ وما منا إلا له مقام معلوم ﴾ فلذلك ليس بينهم تنافس وتقاتل بل مثالهم في تعين مرتبة كل واحد منهم وفعله مثال الحواس الخمس. واعلم أن السلطان به قوام الدين فلا ينبغى أن يستحقر وإن كان ظالما فاسقا.
Know that the creation of the angels [al-mala'ikah] differs from the creation of humankind [al-ins]. There is not a single one of them except that he is singular in attribute [wahdani al-sifah]; there is in him no mixture [khalṭ] or composition [tarkib] whatsoever. Therefore, there cannot be for each one of them except a single action [fi'l wahid]. To this is the allusion in His saying, the Most High: "And there is none of us except that he has a known station [maqam ma'lum]." For this reason, there is no rivalry [tanafus] or fighting [taqatul] between them. Rather, their example [mithaluhum] in the specification of the rank [martabah] of each one of them and his action is like the example of the five senses [al-hawas al-khams]. And know that authority [al-sultan] is that by which religion [al-din] is established. It should not be belittled, even if it is unjust [zaliman] and corrupt [fasiqan].

a.g: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
And indeed, we are those who exalt Allah."
And indeed, the disbelievers used to say,
"If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
We would have been the chosen servants of Allah."
But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.
And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولكن حق القول مني لأملأن جهنم من الجنة والناس أجمعين وقال تعالى إن الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى أولئك عنها مبعدون فإن خطر ببالك أنه لم اختلفت السابقة وهم في ربقه العبودية مشتركون نوديت من سرادقات الجلال لا تجاوز حد الأدب فإنه لا يسئل عما يفعل وهم يسئلون ولعمري تأدب اللسان والظاهر مما يقدر عليه الأكثرون فأما تأدب السر عن إضمار الاستبعاد بهذا الاختلاف الظاهر في التقريب والإبعاد والإشقاء والإسعاد مع بقاء السعادة والشقاوة أبد الآباد فلا يقوى عليه إلا العلماء الراسخون في العلم.
Indeed, My Word [kalima] has become binding: I will surely fill Hell with jinn and mankind together. And He, the Exalted, said: "Indeed, those for whom the best [al-husna] from Us has preceded—they from it are kept far." Now, if it occurs to your mind [qalb] that the precedence [sabiqa] has differed, while they are partners in the bond of servitude ['ubudiyya], you are called from the pavilions of Majesty [jalal]: "Do not transgress the limit of courtesy [adab], for He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned." By my life, disciplining the tongue and the outward [zahir] is within the capacity of most people. But as for disciplining the inner secret [sirr] from harboring a sense of improbability regarding this apparent difference in drawing near [taqrib] and keeping far [ib'ad], and in causing misery [ishqa'] and granting felicity [is'ad], while happiness [sa'ada] and wretchedness [shaqawa] remain for all eternity [abad al-abad]—none are strong enough for this except the scholars firmly rooted in knowledge ['ilm].

a.g: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.
So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.
And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
Then for Our punishment are they impatient?
But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
And leave them for a time.
And see, for they are going to see.
Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
And peace upon the messengers.
And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
